athlete.name: Simone Biles
athlete.story: Simone Biles made a triumphant return to the Olympics in Paris 2024, securing three gold medals and one silver in gymnastics, bringing her total Olympic medal count to 11.

athlete.name: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo
athlete.story: Norwegian cross-country skier Johannes Høsflot Klæbo dominated the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, winning three gold medals and one bronze, solidifying his status as one of the sport's greats.

athlete.name: Caeleb Dressel
athlete.story: American swimmer Caeleb Dressel had a stellar performance at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics (held in 2021), winning five gold medals and setting multiple records.

athlete.name: Marit Bjørgen
athlete.story: Norwegian cross-country skier Marit Bjørgen became the most decorated Winter Olympian in history at PyeongChang 2018, adding five medals to her tally.

athlete.name: Michael Phelps
athlete.story: In his final Olympic appearance at Rio 2016, swimmer Michael Phelps added five golds and one silver to his record, finishing with a total of 28 Olympic medals.

athlete.name: Viktor Ahn
athlete.story: Short track speed skater Viktor Ahn, competing for Russia, won three golds and one bronze at Sochi 2014, becoming the most decorated short track skater in Olympic history.

athlete.name: Michael Phelps
athlete.story: At the London 2012 Olympics, Michael Phelps became the most decorated Olympian of all time, surpassing the previous record with a total of 22 medals.

athlete.name: Marit Bjørgen
athlete.story: Cross-country skier Marit Bjørgen led the medal count at Vancouver 2010, earning five medals and establishing herself as a dominant force in the sport.

athlete.name: Michael Phelps
athlete.story: Michael Phelps made history at Beijing 2008 by winning eight gold medals, breaking the record for the most golds in a single Olympics.

athlete.name: Cindy Klassen
athlete.story: Canadian speed skater Cindy Klassen became the first Canadian athlete to win five medals in a single Winter Olympics at Turin 2006.

athlete.name: Michael Phelps
athlete.story: In his first major Olympic appearance at Athens 2004, Michael Phelps won six golds and two bronzes, signaling the start of his Olympic dominance.

athlete.name: Ole Einar Bjørndalen
athlete.story: Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Bjørndalen achieved a clean sweep at Salt Lake City 2002, winning gold in all four biathlon events.
